melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

translation.text: The Playful Lord imbues all with the Color of His Love.

melody.description: Kaanara invokes feelings of being overcome by a personality, which is so impressive that its character is difficult to stop thinking about. The personality conveyed has a magnetism, which makes you think of them as your own and is able to win you over with its remarkable qualities and outlook.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਕੀਟ ਹਸਤ ਪੂਰਨ ਸਭ ਸੰਗਾ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: From the ant to the elephant, He is permeating and pervading all. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: kīt hasat pūran sabh sangā .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Kaanara invokes feelings of being overcome by a personality, which is so impressive that its character is difficult to stop thinking about. translation.text: Some go on fasts, make vows, and take pilgrimages to sacred shrines on the Ganges.

translation.text: They read through the Shaastras, but they do not join the Sat Sangat, the True Congregation. ||1||

text: ਹਉ ਰੋਗੁ ਬਿਆਪੈ ਚੁਕੈ ਨ ਭੰਗਾ ॥

translation.text: They are afflicted with the disease of egotism, and their faults are not covered up.

transliteration.text: hau rōg biāpai chukai n bhangā .

melody.description: Kaanara invokes feelings of being overcome by a personality, which is so impressive that its character is difficult to stop thinking about. translation.text: They burn in the fire of sexual frustration, unresolved anger and compulsive desire.

text: ਸੋ ਮੁਕਤੁ ਨਾਨਕ ਜਿਸੁ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਚੰਗਾ ॥੨॥੩॥੩੬॥

translation.text: He alone is liberated, O Nanak, whose True Guru is Good. ||2||3||36||

transliteration.text: sō mukat nānak jis satigur changā .2.3.36.
